main.name: Foundation for the Bioregional Autonomy of the Orinoco Watershed
main.description: Our goal is to work with groups, neighbourhoods, hamlets, villages and Community based organisations in the Orinoco River Watershed to regenerate damaged ecosystems, to recognise the local, natural and human resources available and to establish polyculture systems to create self-sufficient, sustainable communities
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

aims.text: To conserve and restore the landscapes and waterways needed for its health.
To fund the implementation of contour drains on the ridge of the St. Ann’s watershed in an attempt to mitigate flooding in the Capital City of Port-of-Spain.
To facilitate the transformation of livelihoods that have been based on industrial scale resource extraction to a regenerative economy with equitable and sustainable resource use.
To act as a catalyst and broker to create the institutions needed to envision, inform and finance a regenerative economy.
To provide support for regeneration entrepreneurs.
To offer tools and resources to those who promote positive change at the intersection of ecosystem regeneration, economic opportunity and community vitality.
To identify high value products based on surplus that require a minimum of processing for economic stability.
To promote community re-vitalization and ecological restoration.
To share information (including genetic) worldwide which facilitates the optimizing of cultural and biological diversity.

quotes.author: Daniel Christian Wahl
quotes.text: It is important to highlight that such regenerative cultures will be different depending on the places and bioregions they emerge from. Just as life’s biodiversity adds to its capacity for creative evolution, so does our cultural diversity constitute a wealth of experience and perspectives. The point is not that we all need to agree on everything or see the world in the same way, rather it is that in our diversity we all aim to participate in ways that support the health, well-being and evolutionary potential of all of humanity and all of life.There is no one-size-fits-all receipt for creating regenerative cultures. Sorry to disappoint.

quotes.author: Thomas Berry
quotes.text: The time has come to lower our voices, to cease imposing our mechanistic patterns on the biological processes of the earth, to resist the impulse to control, to command, to force, to oppress, and to begin quite humbly to follow the guidance of the larger community on which all life depends.
